page.title: 13 My house by Roger
page.content: I live at Mill House. My Daddy says the mill was built about 1840. It was used to grind corn into flour. Its proper name was a Suffolk Post Mill because a large post supported the top part of the mill and the sails. The whole top part of the mill could be turned on the post to make the sails face the wind.My Daddy thinks it had four sails and two grinding wheels. We still have a small piece of one of the Mill stones in our garden. The sails and the top part of the mill were taken down about 1923. My Grandad put a roof on the brick base, called the roundhouse, which is still in our garden.The house we live in was built about the same time as the Mill, as a home for the Miller and his family.
